There might be places where you could stay low and perhaps keep relatively safe, but nothing that sticks out to you, unfortunately. What do you plan to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably pull over or something and look around and see.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just off the road is fine. At this point, I'd like to see the road as well. That way we can see anyone coming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I go ahead and light a torch, see if I can start a fire? Gather some wood?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is a good thing because it gets cold at night out here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we bring any warm clothes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going north.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're the worst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll only get colder the further north you go. Even at night here-- most mornings in Wildemount, at least this area of Wildemount, all the grass is frosted, the windows are frosted. Few moisture survives the evening without some sort of frozen state. As the temperature begins to plummet continuously after sunset, you begin to find a place to set up camp for the evening. Beau takes the torch, ignites it, and sets a small fire. You begin to set up a small circle and maintain warmth by taking what bits of-- and it's very sparse vegetation. If you want to check for anything to keep the fire going, roll a survival check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not great, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to get some brush gathered, you're probably not going to be able to keep the fire going all night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I donate the paper that The Gentleman gave me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a fast burn, that's not going to last very long.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a torch as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a torch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's say if you throw in three torches, that'll keep a modicum of the flame going through the night. Not the most heat, but it'll be enough to prevent you from dealing with the biting cold as you rest through the night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll throw in two, Molly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could camp on top of the cart because we won't be on the ground, it's warmer on there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true, park the cart next to the fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's taking watch?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm taking this silver thread and making a 20-foot cube around the cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take first watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll take first watch with him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the rest of you manage to find yourself asleep for the evening, Jester and Fjord take the first watch. Do you wish to make a perception check?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which one of you is helming?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My perception's shit. How's yours?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not awesome, but it's not horrible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For this group, that's pretty good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll aid you, how about that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm helm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, goddamn it. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping an eye out there, other than a couple bits of whistling wind that blow through in segments, you don't pick up anything shifty, and your watch comes to a close without issue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was an easy watch, then!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next watch?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take second watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Perception check at disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's helming perception check on this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How's your perception?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plus two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have plus three.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're aiding. Technically, because it's night, it would be a straight roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, she's advantaging me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're helping her to maintain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil, and 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping your senses around you and looking about, the watch seems to go through, uneventful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Want to huddle together for body warmth?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure, but Frumpkin is making me so warm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, no, I'm good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have a very warm shawl, too, but do you want my--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, my robe is good. It's thin, but it's high thread count. It's very good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is as far as I've ever been, you know?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In terms of?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispered) Romantically.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Here, I've only been to Xhorhas and Zadash.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long since you left Xhorhas? Did you grow up there? That's a better question, take that one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did grow up in Xhorhas. I did grow up there, but I left there, I think it was about--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispered) Eight months ago.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think it was about eight months ago, yeah, from what I can remember. All of this is still very new, you know? I like this stuff, grass and things, you know?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You appreciate grass?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think so, it's a much softer ground to sit on, you know? Instead of a marshy, sandy--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow, yeah?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh. What was your favorite part about Zadash? Xhorhas?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know if I had a favorite part.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it that bad?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean, it's all I know, but it's probably not the best place to grow up, now that I'm seeing everything else, you know? I think, sometimes I wish maybe it was a little different.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you still have that "This is home" connection with it though? No?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. I think I will always have that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's nice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope to see it someday.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know if you're going to be that impressed by it, but maybe you'll like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can see your breath (exhales).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. Well, I wonder, I mean, I wonder if anyone else-- I think, is our time up, or--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was such church youth trip flirting!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great first date.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, your watch comes uneventful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: God's really cool, right? Right, right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Third and final watch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me and Caleb. Me and Molly, I guess. I'm on third watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take third watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott and Molly. Who's helming this one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's your-- your perception's probably high as balls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't know!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, you take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Advantage on yours. Actually, it would have been the first one. I started to realize, it's advantage, but disadvantage because it's night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, ten. Why is it disadvantage?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because it's night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys get part way through your watch, conversing, muttering about the recent events, the sun comes up, uneventful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should've put money on Beau. Kicking myself for not putting money on Beau.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If it makes you feel any better, I lost money on Jester on the next one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It does actually make me feel better, thank you!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, you guys? I was at a disadvantage!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're not there, you can't hear any of this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're all camping together!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're asleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you guys are still on your watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Although that would be what I would imagine Jester saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was just an impression.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (as Jester) Guys, it's so crazy, you know? (as Taliesin) That was terrible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, she's like Luigi? (as Luigi) It's a-crazy!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wild and crazy guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (as Luigi) Let's-a go. (as Matt) With that, morning comes. Without the necessary heat, the fire, the torch, goes out, and right as the frost begins to cause you to shake yourself awake, the morning comes, melting the dew, and you are prepped up on your cart and ready for the next length of your journey.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so brisk and wonderful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was the best sleep I have had in a long time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think The Gentleman wakes up with frost on his face or his whole body?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Probably! Unless he mops himself down at night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if he has to crack himself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, think about his sheets! What a disaster his sheets must be!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has to wash them every night. They would be so gross.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like when you get a sunburn and you wake up, and they're fucking sticking to you and stuff? It sucks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're a little dewy, and you don't know why?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've got to rip them off, just one big one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey Nott, do you think we're going to go by your hometown when we're driving up here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, my hometown is further to the south, it's the opposite direction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. But there is no hometown. We travel around a lot, we have an area of operation, but never really called one place home.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you're nomadic. Do you have little huts you put up as camping tents?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whatever we can find, really, leaves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you like that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's terrible. Would you like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, I've never tried it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's not fun at all. You find whatever piece of cloth you can and wrap yourself in it and some mud and that's your bed. It's terrible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that why you left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That and many other things, yes. Have you ever seen a goblin before?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I saw you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Well, have you seen any others?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Have you heard stories of them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could tell you, but I feel like it's offensive or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, you can tell me. There's no love there. Everything you've heard about goblins is true. They're awful in every way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, my mom used to tell me that if you act up too much, the goblins will come in the middle of the night and steal you away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My father used to tell me that they would steal children.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so that's true. But it doesn't really matter if you're good or bad; we will come and steal you if you are a child, anyway.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And would you eat? Because my mom said you would eat them!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take it easy. We would share with the rest of the clan. But of course we would eat children.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is she telling the truth? Do I feel like she's telling the truth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me, Nott, are you taking the piss right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm really not. Goblins are terrible, terrible creatures.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you ever eat a little child, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With great honesty I can tell you that I've never eaten a child.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Insight check. I've been holding out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wish to see if she's telling the truth, roll an insight check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope. Natural one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kind of hard to read.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's hard to read. She seems honest and forthright in what she's saying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has she tasted human flesh?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen. My clan, I can't speak for other clans, but the goblins that I was with for quite some time, we stole from people. We stole food, we stole money when we could, we stole clothing and provisions, but when times were tough, we would steal the people, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You and your brothers and sisters? Or you and your children or parents?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, goblins don't really-- I'm sure I have parents.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. But you're not super tight with them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. Once a child is born and nursed for a bit and then it's communal property. As soon as you can work, they give you a job and you do the job.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No favorite brother or sister or playmate or--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you even know who your brothers and sisters are?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone in the clan, I assume, is related somehow, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. There was no real family ties.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you fight any urges when you see a small child walking through the city, to go up and, I don't know, I don't mean any disrespect, but to snatch it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounds a little shitty, Fjord.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's definitely a little shitty.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But yeah, you don't see it and you don't get hungry?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, I'm being honest. Because if I know there's a little kid running around, and if you're fucking tracing the damn thing, I want to know that I can put a hand out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With all due respect, she is smarter than that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, as always, is right. I do not have an urge to kill and eat children.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just checking. I haven't met many that do, so pardon my, you know--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do have cravings for things I assume you, other species, do not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like what? Maybe we do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rats.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, that I understand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cats sometimes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin goes back to the Feywild.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bacon. I really like bacon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everyone likes bacon. Bacon is super good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A human child is a wonderful thing. Why would I want to kill or hurt a human child?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! She doesn't want to hurt her baby, Caleb!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. I'm not bloodthirsty. I just get hungry for food sometimes. Not for flesh. I just like meat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want some?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would love some.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, here you go. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (eating noises) No. I like children a great deal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In your belly?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! Not in my belly! You're borderline offensive!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All Fjord sees is a little kid's hand, like chewing on a little kid's hand

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's helming watch as you guys are traveling?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, I'm on one of the horses. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check for me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no. This'll be funny. Come on, first good roll of the day. That'll do. That's a 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's enough. As you guys are continuing, about midday or so, you're hitting the noonday sun, and some of the clouds have broken up briefly. You notice a tiny distant curl of smoke over one of the hills. Just a lazy little line of darkness across the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it look like happy fire smoke, or bad, unfortunate, something's burning, dark?--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks very localized.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here is my definite backstory.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we'll do this later. Do you see the smoke over there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: --one day--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's definitely a plume of smoke. I don't know what it means, I don't know what it's about, it could be a good thing, it could be a bad thing, but we have to stop this conversation right in its tracks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, what is it? Does it look like good smoke or bad smoke?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, I can't tell from here. It's very localized.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it into the woods or is it further along?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it into the woods, or further along?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot see. It's over one of the larger hills that's blocking what its source is. It's about a mile or so off of the road if you were to go ahead in that direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's about a mile off the road.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just chimney smoke. Just keep moving.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It doesn't look like chimney smoke. I'm not sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So there's fire. So what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Campfire smoke?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it look like campfire smoke?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It could be. It could be chimney smoke. It's not a billowing column.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not a

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When you say it, it has such a different color to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's people, though. Or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're burning people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, just be on alert. They could be burning anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll find, once and for all, the answer: What do children taste like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, nestled between a small cluster of trees and a bit of natural rock formations, a small shack that the smoke is coming from.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a small shack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continue going forward on the road?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go knock on the door?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you want to see if somebody worth bargaining with or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't we send my cat?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Weird people live in shacks in the woods.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They'll be happy to see a cat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Send the cat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think we're even going to pull over.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we'll just keep going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is the shed from where we are now, still like a mile away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's about a mile away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If it's of interest, we can turn around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The shack is a mile away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can Frumpkin be a bird?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (reluctantly) Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For a bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to check out the shack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. For you, Fjord, I will make Frumpkin a bird.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not for me, though. Caleb hates me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could just walk over there. It's a hassle to turn him into a bird.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Keep your cat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are more sensitive than I would have imagined.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want people to like me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're so tough, but everybody here likes you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yasha's leading the way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're checking out the shack?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we really? Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A really cool hour?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha's going to the shack. Is it just Yasha?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm following.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, she's going to the shack?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Yasha, Molly, and Fjord are heading to the shack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll be right back!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put Frumpkin back on her shoulder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a tanning easel set there for whoever has been utilizing it. There is a front door. You see a window that has no glass in it. It's maybe that big or so, it's more for keeping an eye out, or looking through it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanning the land and the trees around, doing a quick once-over of the close area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Looks clear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll head around back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to get off my horse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get off the horse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to start looking through Frumpkin in an attempt to let Yasha know I am with her. I make Frumpkin do this to her forehead (knocking) with his paw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This soft paw starts tapping you in the face.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (spitting) Stop it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's a good question. I know that we were loosey-goosey with familiar things. I know that we've said that I can see this far away, but I probably cannot make him do that this far away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Command, right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 100 feet, I take it back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still blow, and the fur gets in your nose. Fjord, you head around back? In the back, there's a couple of cured and salted meats that are hanging from the back of the ramshackled roof that ends, and curves down a bit. Over time the weathering has caused it to curl under. There is another doorway that leads in the back. It looks like there is no window back here. There is a single window out front, and there are two doors in the front and back of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll make my way another quarter way around the house so I can see Yasha and Molly, and I'll say: Go ahead, I'll keep an eye out. I can see both.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to knock on the door, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems fair.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (knocking)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you see what I can only describe as an elderly full-blood orc. His head wreathed and tangled grey coarse hair, like a crown around the top of the head that goes past the mouth and over the chest to about mid-point there. A foot-long beard around his chin that ends at about the bottom of the clavicle, or the sternum. Muscular and hunched, his gray-green skin looks thick and weathered, and folded crow's nests under where the nose and the mouth is, the two heavy tusks protruding from underneath the lower jaw. His eyes are sunken and bloodshot, around the side of the yellow sclera. One hand opens the door, while another one remains out of sight. As the face pushes forward to inspect you, a low voice says, "Your business?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, yes, hello. We were just passing through and we saw some smoke, so we just wanted to make sure everything was okay, and come over here and check on you, but you seem to be fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Everything is fine."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Selling any wares? Or do you need any news from the other side of the road?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Have you news to share?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There are skirmishes at the border, and soldiers are moving east, lots of them, worth noting. We're trying to avoid it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good to know." The door begins to close.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But did you have-- I don't think you answered the other part of what he was saying. Do you have any wares for--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For sale.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: For sale?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leans further in.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Like some meats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a charisma check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Now, I have a minus two, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that's still.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, all right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shimmy the shake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a bit of a grunt, and the breath emanates, and it smells of heavy pepper and dust. A bit of smokiness to it. The door opens slightly more, and the head peeks through to give you a good look over. "Maybe for trade."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What kind of trade?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do you have to trade?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The cat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reaches out and--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, do it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm just moving him around. I can't!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have some bits and pieces, what do you need? We have gold, but you don't really strike me as the type who cares.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Gold doesn't hurt other passersby."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a few bits. What do you need? Do you need tools?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tools are helpful."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to pull out--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Vegetables. Fresh produce, maybe."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have anything? Fresh produce we're a little thin on because we're just on the road, but we do have--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We might have some bacon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense here, based on the tanning stuff set up outside, that that's probably part of his trading business.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's also for trade or purchase. Also, I have meats. I have pelts."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How much are you selling the hide armor for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Handmade. 15 gold pieces."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How about 16 gold pieces and you throw in a little bit of meat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I give you two pounds of meat."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He coughs a bit, goes over, and starts grabbing the armor and pulling it off of the knob and setting it down, grabbing some meat. He opens the back door and steps out and starts pulling it off of some of the racks of nails on there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can hear it, but I can't see it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You're staying where you are?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll start making my way over to their horses, having heard them go inside. I think.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would say Caleb has been narrating this to everybody back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? Okay. He grabs the meats, sets them in a small sack, ties it up, hands it over. The armor he preps and folds and sets over, hands it to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I pay the man. Pleasure doing business with you. Be careful. There's soldiers running around all over the place right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm aware."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Have a lovely day.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank you very much. Apologies for intruding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good luck." He closes the door. You hear (deadbolts locking).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who was that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've met weirder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What was in there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It looks like there's some hide armor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And meat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Nice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, we got some food for the road.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was a trapdoor in the floor and there were just people stuck underneath there, wasn't there? Three more points on that perception roll and I'd have been like "That carpet looks like it's been moved recently."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was it just the one guy in there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It seemed like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I've met weirder people.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He is selling stuff if you want to go check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What did he have? Just meat and--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Meat and--

lines.name: TALIESIN, ASHLEY
lines.text: Armor.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, okay. Shall we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys mount back up on your horses and make your way back to the rest of the group on the cart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of armor is it out of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hide armor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's hide armor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's well-made, hand-crafted hide armor, for anybody who would have use for it, whether it be using or reselling it. That's up to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We made a friend.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you kill someone for that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He's dead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Twice. Same man.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But that shack is now ours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great! Can we stay the night there?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should just live here instead of going anywhere else.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm thinking of planting soybeans.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is our kingdom.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is our keep. What do we name it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Small Shit Keep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shall we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's keep going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys continue onward for the rest of the day until, eventually, the sun sets and you find yourselves with evening quickly taking the sky.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's make camp before we completely lose light this time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's helming the search for a good place to camp?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll look this time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check with advantage because the sun is still up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't fuck this up, Fjord.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You rolled the same, well, almost the same.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, but I'm helping him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So he got advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus? But you said advantage? Oh, right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance off, and maybe about 30 minutes up the road you can see a small forest, maybe two or three miles in diameter. It's a cluster of trees and would probably be a way to camp off of the road.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a cluster of trees up ahead. We could aim for that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of meat is this, out of curiosity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope. It's just going today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is meat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: As far as I know, it could be veggie.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to take a little niblet of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little chewy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's very good. From tasting it, do I know what it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If only I had help counting to the number four!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you ever tried human before?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll see. Don't fuck me, Gil. Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's very good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not sure where it's coming from, but I definitely think--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I like it a lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm getting a taste for it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, it's a delicacy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to start making a nice, pretty bed in the cart. It's going to be really nice looking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For all of us or just you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For anyone who wants to stay in here with me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: LAURA Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to make a fire again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We can break off some branches and some kindling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's trees.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can do that. You manage to set up right as the sun completes setting. You build up this little campfire in the center. You set up your bedding around it. The cart is a little ways off. Unless you're putting the bedding in the cart and putting that there next to it? Okay. You put the cart there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Silver thread.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thread around the edges. Okay. Who's taking first watch?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take first watch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take first watch. Unless someone objects. All right, that'll do. Do you want to or-- What's your-- I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a normal roll because you are keeping an eye through darkness.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But I have night vision?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Night vision is only out to a certain radius.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both maintain the first watch as you continue looking out towards the darkness beyond the visible trees that are refracting what little bit of light makes it to their bark. Looking into the shadows, your watch comes to an end, uneventful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so glad to be out of that bloody city.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, me too, I guess. I just am excited to see more, you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's nice to be on the road again.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, it's nice to be on the road.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've never been up this way before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You haven't?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not that I can remember. Not that I know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If I look around, are there flowers anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You haven't done that before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Where's investigation? Oh, eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a little while. You start getting a little nervous, because Yasha just vanishes in the darkness, saying, "I'll be right back," and is gone for like 40 minutes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, she's going to be gone for another six days now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I found poison oak, you guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do come back with a handful of small posies. They're nothing special, but they're flowers.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I found some of these. I'm going to put them in my book. I've gotten a lot of different ones now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's lovely.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. I'm going to save them. I'm getting quite the collection.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then I'm going to crumple them up!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys finish your watch. Who's taking the next watch?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We will.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I got it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Nott and Caleb. Who's taking point on this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you can't see in the dark.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have (popping noises)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: With advantage or straight?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will aid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be a straight roll for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Straight roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The lanterns, they're helping you see the close vicinity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will still do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say sure. How far can the lights go out? What's the range?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I think it's 60 feet? I bet that's wrong. It is 120 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so roll with advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you're keeping an eye out beyond the various tree trunks. You hear the snapping of a twig and you see some shifting of shadow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, there's something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm, what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whack!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which direction? Point to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just smack Beau and then--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit. Are they all on one? Do I see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance around and he's pointing this out and you begin to come to consciousness--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I cast Mage Armor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispered) Jester!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At that moment, as soon as you finish casting Mage Armor, there's a little flash of arcane energy and two arrows come shooting out of the shadows, right towards you. Natural 20 and a six, which would bring it to ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The second does not hit, but the first one obviously does.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You suffer five points of piercing damage as the arrow catches you right in the left pectoral muscle, and I need you to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Poison arrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or a sleep arrow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or a health cure arrow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not great. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys all see this happen, you glance around and you can see a bunch of small shapes beginning to skitter from around some of the trees. This growling sound, almost barking sound. There's a few strange, furred wolves emerging from one side, two or three of them, their eyes glistening as the light from the fire manages to catch it from an angle. Behind them, these two heavy forms begin to emerge, and one of them goes, "Oh no! They've awakened! Gonah!" "I know, Emmett!" And we'll come back to roll initiative here as we're going to take a quick break.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The break? Okay. That felt like the end for some reason.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It did! I got panicked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No cliffhanger!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. We have a water break. We'll come back on that and roll initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As your guys' campfire caught someone's attention. For our Wyrmwood giveaway tonight--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit! I wanted to talk to Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Never going to happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I was thinking (grunts)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tonight we're giving out our fantastic ziricote dice tray from our friends at Wyrmwood.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's sexy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt's wood.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm pretty sure, yeah. This is the wood that I use on mine. Very slick. Tonight's keyword is "memories." If you want to, come into the Twitch chat. Enter the phrase once. More than once and you'll be disqualified and, unfortunately, it's only available to friends in the U.S. and Canada except for Quebec. But we'll come back with the winner here at the end of the break.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay bye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congrats to you, my friend. Exactly. I guess I should bring out the map.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bring it out!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At least we got a surprise attack. That's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anyway Caleb, this is what happened to me as-- Oh no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, they're huge!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's big people. There's little people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing around, you see a cluster of goblin-like creatures coming out of the nearby forest, helmed by two large ogres that are yelling across the way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said goblin-

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is very shadowy and dark. You can't even see. A cluster of wolves also are circling from that side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wolves? Goblins? Oh shit balls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I did not have the cart and horses with me, I thought I did and I left them at home. We'll say that they got spooked after the arrows were fired and are off the side of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice improv!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here we go!

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: (chanting) Level five!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're asleep, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I-- (concerned sound) Okay. All right, to that note, friends: 25 to 20?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 24! A natural 20 on the most useless category. Not a useless category, but in terms of a Nat 20, meh. But exciting! I don't want to shit on it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't want to curse it, right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not cursing!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb, Fjord, Molly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's really what I do best, guys. It's my most consistent thing that I do is roll shit initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Through both campaigns.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: In life and in-- Yeah, always.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 to ten?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow. Ten to five?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Six!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wait, I never said mine. 15. Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was expecting another six.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what'd you have Molly?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had 16.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As these creatures begin to come out of the shadows, preparing for their continuation of their assault, Beau, you're up first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh Jesus. Oh boy. Where am I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're right there. Caleb nudged you awake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wake up and I go: Fight Club! I run towards whatever I see first. Do I see the wolf? Do I see the goblins?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking this way, as he nudged you, you see the wolves, these goblin creatures here, and this large, looming ogre that was shouting across the way to the other ogre, who's now pushing past the tree and coming into view.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau, in her hazy boss phase, goes: Ogres are the leaders. And she runs straight for the ogre.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you dart past, it'll put you right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two attacks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you rush up, grabbing your staff from the ground, getting the sleep from your face, you run towards it. Swing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The first attack is a ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten misses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, and the second attack also misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both first strikes attack. That's your attack action.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those are both my attack actions. I'm going to use a ki point to go into Patient Defense at that point because that sucked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You swing twice. You're still groggy from being woken up and your blows go a bit wide. The ogre laughs as it palms away one of your strikes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I yawn and then go into a stance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you get into a stance, you look down and there's the wolf growling, its jaws open, its teeth exposed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn back to Jester and I go: Jester! Puppies! Patient Defense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The goblins are taking their turn now. I rolled really high on their initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They are goblins!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so two against Caleb. That's cocked. That's going to be a 12?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 12 does not hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a six.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does not hit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, both miss. Both deflecting off of the Mage Armor you put up before.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (vomiting)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be one against Nott. It's going to be an eight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You duck out of the way and it goes vanishing into the darkness beyond. That's going to be two against Yasha. That's going to be a nine? And a 23?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take four points of piercing damage and you need to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh fuck.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How many points of damage did you say? I'm sorry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four points of piercing damage, and make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh that's right, from the first shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's an arrow sticking out of my ribs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. The arrow hits you, and you feel the poison pulse through. You flex and grit your teeth, and your body manages to prevent the poison from taking root into your system.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh shit, sorry! I was just trying to-- That's how I get rid of the poison. (airy fart)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be two to Jester. That's going to be a 14? And a 19!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As I'm lifting my shield, the other one gets underneath it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's five points of piercing damage to you. Make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 15.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Misses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Misses. As you have your shield now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I take damage from that one arrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, you're up with Fjord on deck.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to push through the pain in my veins and reach into my satchel and smear molasses on my hand. I'm going to cast Slow on this batch here. They have to make a wisdom save against my DC.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's some southern shit. Get the molasses out your ass!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wisdom save.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 16 is the DC.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 is the DC! All right. For that ogre over there, that's a failure. He's going to be slow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Speed is halved. Takes negative two to AC and dexterity saving throws. Can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's an 18. It succeeds. That one there. That's another 18! Two in a row! Sorry about that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's okay. I'm going to use my movement to get closer into the fire. Maybe over towards Molly and Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. You are maintaining Slow concentration on him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you roll a save against poison, or no?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he's just poisoned.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What'd you cast on the big guy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Slow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That being the case, that finishes up Caleb's turn. Fjord, you're up with Molly on deck.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to use my bonus action to cast Hexblade's Curse on the big ol' fellow that Caleb pointed at.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you suddenly watch him, already a sluggish creature, moving at an even more sluggish pace, the shadows around, all of a sudden, jump off of the nearby tree trunks and cling to the interior of its form, around where the nooks and crannies are. Almost like a small-scale Venom symbiote at times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I use my 30 feet of speed to run this way, southeast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Southeast. Around this way, or this way?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Between these two trees, if I can. Towards this direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That's ten. 15. 20. 25.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I get within melee of this guy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do get past this guy, who does get an attack of opportunity on you, if you'd like.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh really? Five, ten, 15, 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. I'm going to come this way, over here, if I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Five. Ten. 15. 20. 25. 30.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's where you get, there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will use Eldritch Blast against those two goblins hiding behind the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right there? As you rush past, you spin around with the sword and shield in one hand. I mean, you haven't drawn your falchion yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't pulled it yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so you just spin around, releasing from your grip--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I now have two bursts of Eldritch Blast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. One attack for each.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a 12 for the first one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That does not hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second one hits! The first one, the goblin has a shield affixed to its wall and it knocks it out of the way. The Eldritch Blast just poofs without any sort of impact. The second one does hit the other-- it poops!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's four plus four is eight, plus four is 12. 12 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The other goblin goes flying back about five or six feet, tumbles to the ground, and is not moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. That completes my turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Finishing Fjord's turn. Molly, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to run directly at the creature right there. On the way, I'm going to use my bonus action to start one of my scimitars. I think I get two attacks with that scimitar, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. Is this with your Rite of the Dawn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The scimitar gleams with this faint, glowing, radiant energy, this luminescent glow to the blade as he swings towards the singular goblin. Make your attacks, if you'd like.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Setting my new max HP. All right! Attack number one is 16 to hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 16 hits the goblin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just double checking, I'm still at a d4 for--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. That's (counting) 11 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 points of damage. That'll do it. You rush up and carve right through his torso.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I still have movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to head around the tree for the other one that--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's (counting) 30. You can get right up behind with that goblin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take one shot at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ugh. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you swing towards it, it manages to take a shield and deflect the blade, and your scimitar sticks into the side of the tree, and you have to pull it forth and dislodge and prepare yourself for the next round.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes Molly's go. Now, the ogres take their turn. This one right here, next to Beau, as you charged up and attempted to pummel it, go in a defensive stance, (chuckles). He's going to make two greatclub swings towards you, with disadvantage, because you have your-- Even with disadvantage, that is a 19 to hit? I rolled a 19 and a 13.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. The second one, that is an 18 and a 14.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is 13 points of bludgeoning damage as it slams into you and you hit up against the tree. As you barely catch yourself and right, the second swing goes through, and with that, you manage to pull underneath, your defensive stance ready to go, and you jam the club into the tree. The tree actually shakes, sending a bunch of leaves and a couple of birds scatter out from the inside as the ogre pulls the club back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 13, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. With that, the ogre goes ahead and-- Actually, he's just going to move over here, and is going to shout at the dogs, "Go! Carve face!" The dogs get ready to pounce.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did they say carve face?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Car face!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Car face!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ogre only has 20 feet of movement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's All Dogs Go to Heaven, you guys!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that half of his movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He has 40 movement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the only action it takes, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be a 23 to hit? Natural 17.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take it because Shield won't match the difference.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the javelin, which does-- (pained inhale)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, the in-suck is the worst!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 points of piercing damage. The javelin sinks into your stomach and embeds itself about four or five inches into your torso to the point where the javelin's now holding itself out from your body. You immediately grab it, and the shock hits you that it managed to drive itself so deep inside. You aren't even aware of the damage it's done to your internals, it's put you in a state of shock. That's going to end that guy's turn, but it gets to make a saving throw to try and resist the Slow spell. That is going to be 15.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your spell DC is 16, yeah! It rolled a natural 17, minus two. Not very wise, these guys, so he remains slow. However, I need you to make a concentration check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh boy, roll high.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did well. Concentration is-- I've never done this before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to maintain your Slow spell on him, no issue. The ogre's turns are done. Nott, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I yell to Caleb: Modern Literature! Then I run towards these two goblins over here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Over this side?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 15, 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take out my hand crossbow and I point it from the goblins to Caleb, and I fire.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm aiming for the book strapped under his armpit that only I know is under his clothes, and I rolled a natural 20.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is. Essentially, because you're aiming for such a small piece there, I was going to add five to the armor class, but a natural 20 hits. As he's pulled back and clutching himself, you hit the book that's harnessed under his arm. You feel the impact-- nope!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh,

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's going to play dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You fall prone on the ground. I will ask you to make another concentration check because you are averting your gaze and attention from the creature you are focusing on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? You're fine. Ten is the DC you had to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fuck. He's like this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, just out of the corner of his eye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mom coming into the room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm looking through my eyelashes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I do need you to make a deception check, but with advantage, because you managed to pull this off pretty well so far. This is just to convince others.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where's my Percy die?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do you guys call this one? What do you call this con?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Modern Literature.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Deception, you say? It is an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18? As far as they're concerned, Caleb is dead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whoa, that was sexy! You guys, we need formations! We need code words!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was my bonus action. For my action, I will tell the two goblins--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, in order to do the bonus action strike, you have to have attacked with your action. It's either two attacks or something else.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now I have a bonus action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a bonus action, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I use it to talk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so in Goblin, I'm going to say to them: I'll hold them off! You get the loot with the horses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's in Goblin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, this is persuasion or deception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be deception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. They look at you, confused. One of them looks over towards the horses. The other one seems to be holding his ground, but it looks like one of them is in the moment of looking off to something else. That ends your turn. Jester and Yasha, you guys are up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (screaming) Caleb!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. As far as you guys know, Nott just turned on you with the rest of the goblins and shot down Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If I fucking waste one of my fucking spells... Caleb! I rush over and I cast Cure Wounds at 2nd-level to heal Caleb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, there you go. You move over, stepping over the campfire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! Don't save him!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Laura, committing to RP! Yes!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No meta in this family, y'all. No meta in this family. Not in this house!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're blowing it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We won't have it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I should have told everyone the names of all the set plays!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be 2d8 plus four. Oh, that's 12 plus eight, so 20 points of healing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You heal 20 hit points, Caleb. Do you continue to play dead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The spell doesn't have an effect on Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (crying) It's not working! I don't know what's going on! I'm going to use my bonus action--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But really, I'm up to full!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're at full?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, because I have no hit points.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use my bonus action to cast Sacred Flame at the ogre that is attacking us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sacred Flame is an action though, isn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it is. I'm sorry, I was thinking, because it's a cantrip-- you're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bonus action. There's not really anything I can do, is there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move. You still have like 20 feet of movement.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (tearily) I'm going to try to drag Caleb away from the fire, behind Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At half movement, you grab and start dragging Caleb face down through the dirt to about there is as far as you can get him through rocks and sticks. Twigs and shit are getting caught in your hair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's re-dirtying me for me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (through clenched teeth) Stop it, stop!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (similarly) For fuck's sake!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (pigeon cooing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (high pitched) He's alive!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes Jester's turn. Yasha, what are you doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is what Dungeons & Dragons is all about.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Give me that pigeon any day, man. (coos) He's alive!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll look back at Jester: I'll save us, it's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To this guy?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, the other one, up here. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You step forward past there, and you get right up into the grill of the slowed ogre.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to get really mad, and I'm going to use Necrotic Shroud.

lines.name: SAM, TRAVIS
lines.text: What is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys watch here, the campfire suddenly dims. The flames flicker and cool to this low, orange glow from the vibrant yellow flame it was before as Yasha steps past the flame. Behind the shawl, two large, skeletal, black wings emerge from the back of her shoulder blades.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like real, or like see-through?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can they see it? Because it's only if you're within ten feet of the person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has that effect, but it's still visible, I'm pretty sure.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, I think you're right. The effect is only--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The effect is only within ten feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they real, or are they see-through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look at a somewhat translucent, skeletal wing structure with membranous, undead-looking wings.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the shit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As that happens, this dark energy emanates from her body, and for a second, the white tips of her hair go completely black. As she steps forward, striding, with her blade in her hands--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (electric guitar riff)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Currently, Nott, you're the only one who can see this, but her eyes go jet black. Entirely full darkness, a void of light where her eyes once were as this happens and she strides forward. Charisma saving throw on his point, there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: On all of our points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, he does succeed. However, you do manage to maintain the rest of your ability.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so now I have an attack, because of Extra Attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, you have two attacks. Oh, no, this is an action to do that, so no, you cannot attack this round.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Even the extra action?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because you get two attacks for the attack action. But that's your action.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I'd like to rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you may. As you step up to this ogre, your wings unfurled, you give out this heavy Yasha roar that echoes in the space around you as your wings flex out even further. This dark energy pulling in, and the ogre's like (confused grunts)-- looking taken aback by this unexpected display of power.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We might need a mini for that, because that sounds awesome. Holy shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Going to have to look into that. Is that your turn, Yasha?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, because I'm not going to move.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, it is the wolves' turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wolves? Where are the wolves?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's two wolves, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are three wolves. These wolves here, watching you drag Caleb backward, all rush in to charge against you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I get a hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because they moved outside of your range there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He ran by me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one does.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get one attack of opportunity against that guy. Go ahead and roll for it. If you hit him he gets-- That's cocked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (disappointed) Okay. 12?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 hits. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As part of the Sentinel feat--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't get to move.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey-oh, 12 damage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 damage?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I rolled an eight.

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: A 20, on the first one. Not a natural 20.

lines.text: No. That's going to be double 19s on that one, Jesus Christ! I'm rolling really good tonight! Both hit you.

lines.text: Yes.

I think that's all of them that have gone, so that is going to lead us to Caleb.

lines.name: ASHLEY

lines.text: It happens. Oh, it's magnets?

lines.text: (growls)

lines.text: Okay! Fucking want to (mumbling). Die! Okay, first one is a seven, second one is a six.
